oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-12-21 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 21, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Marty Robbins (host/performer), guest performer Brenda Lee, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 950th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Marty Robbins; Rod Brasfield; Brenda Lee; Tommy Jackson; Jordanaires; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Marty Robbins -- Jingle Bells (Marty Robbins, Jordanaires) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Marty Robbins) -- Marty Robbins introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Marty Robbins) -- Marty Robbins introduces Brenda Lee -- Christy Christmas (Brenda Lee) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Marty Robbins) -- Marty Robbins introduces Tommy Jackson -- Sugar In The Gourd (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Marty Robbins talks -- Blue Christmas (Marty Robbins, Jordanaires) -- Marty Robbins introduces Chet Atkins -- Hark! The Herald Angels Sing / Deck The Halls (medley) (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jordanaires (Musical group); Jackson, Tommy; Robbins, Marty; Lee, Brenda, 1944-
